title: She’s the Face of the 2024 Paris Olympics, and France is Aflutter
text:
PARIS—She is, depending whom you ask, an elusive and carefree Parisienne who rides a vintage bicycle and smokes in cafes. Or, she’s the face of a shampoo ad. Or, perhaps, an anti-feminist symbol.

This is the logo for the 2024 Olympic and Paralympic Games in Paris. It breaks with more than a century of tradition that saw countries devise innocuous, crowd-pleasing emblems to steer clear of any arguments. Tokyo 1964 featured a rising sun. Innsbruck 1976 hinted at a ski chalet. Sydney 2000 was bold enough to pick a boomerang.

...
description: The 2024 version is like Marianne, but a flapper, who’s pouting, and also a flame and a gold medal. It’s also been derided as looking like a dating app and being sexist.
